concern:
Not sure if anyone else feels this way but it can be a lonely journey in grad school especially because of the niche stresses, things we have to deal with. 

Created a group me that will hopefully foster some community for people to talk with one another and build some friendships or the very least camaraderie 

Here’s the link to join: You're invited to my new group 'Grad School Community' on GroupMe. Click here to join: https://groupme.com/join_group/86601776/iTupsbUn

dialogue_total.statement: Hi there! I'm glad you came in today. Feel free to share what's on your mind or any concerns you might have.
Hey, thanks. I've just been feeling a bit isolated in grad school. It's hard to connect with others who get the same kind of stresses.
It sounds like grad school has been quite challenging for you. What do you imagine your experience might look like if you felt more connected with others?
If I felt more connected, I'd probably feel less overwhelmed. It would be nice to have people to talk to who really understand what I'm going through.

Feeling connected seems really important to you. Based on what you've mentioned, possible options might include joining a study group or a grad school social club. What steps do you think you could take to start feeling more connected?

client: I've actually started a GroupMe chat for grad students to create a sense of community and camaraderie. I'm hoping it’ll help me and others find some support and maybe even make a few friends who understand the grad school grind.

It's wonderful to hear you've taken a proactive step by starting a GroupMe chat for grad students. That initiative shows real courage and a desire to build a supportive network. By creating this space, you're not only helping yourself but also offering others a chance to connect and share their experiences. As you continue with this, remember that it's okay to reach out and invite people to engage. 

The goals you've set are clear: seeking a sense of community and mutual support. You've already taken a significant action step by initiating the chat, and that's something to be proud of. For coping strategies, consider setting aside regular times to engage with the group or even suggesting in-person meetups when possible. 

As a next step, you might reflect on how the chat is going and think about any additional activities or discussions that could deepen these connections. You’ve got a great foundation, and I’m confident that you'll find the camaraderie you’re seeking. Keep nurturing those connections, and remember, I'm here to support you along the way.
Thanks, I appreciate that. I'm hoping the chat will lead to some good connections, but I'm worried people might not be that interested.
